qas.question: The neighborhood of Newtowne West is north of what street?
Along with Newtowne West, to what neighborhood is Carver regarded as having comparable demographics?
What Richmond street contains a notable amount of Victorian buildings?
In what part of Richmond is the Virginia Museum of Fine Arts found?
What is the primary race of the population of the Randolph neighborhood?

context: The area between Belvidere Street, Interstate 195, Interstate 95, and the river, which includes Virginia Commonwealth University, is socioeconomically and architecturally diverse. North of <a0_0>Broad<a0_0/> Street, the Carver and Newtowne West neighborhoods are demographically similar to neighboring <a1_0>Jackson Ward<a1_0/>, with Carver experiencing some gentrification due to its proximity to VCU. The affluent area between the Boulevard, Main Street, Broad Street, and VCU, known as the Fan, is home to <a2_0>Monument Avenue<a2_0/>, an outstanding collection of Victorian architecture, and many students. West of the Boulevard is the <a3_0>Museum District<a3_0/>, the location of the Virginia Historical Society and the Virginia Museum of Fine Arts. South of the Downtown Expressway are Byrd Park, Maymont, Hollywood Cemetery, the predominantly <a4_0>black<a4_0/> working class Randolph neighborhood, and white working class Oregon Hill. Cary Street between Interstate 195 and the Boulevard is a popular commercial area called Carytown.
